Text: I lift up my eyes to You, the One enthroned in heaven.
Context: The psalmist expresses a sincere dependence and trust in God, acknowledging His sovereignty and looking to Him for mercy.

Text: As the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maidservant to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the LORD our God until He shows us mercy.
Context: The psalmist compares the trusting and expectant posture of God’s people to that of servants towards their masters, emphasizing the dependency and hope for God’s mercy.

Text: Have mercy on us, O LORD, have mercy, for we have endured much contempt.
Context: The plea for mercy is intensified by the context of suffering and the weariness from being scorned by the arrogant.

Text: We have endured much ridicule from the proud, much contempt from the arrogant.
Context: The psalmist shares the affliction faced by God’s people, highlighting the emotional impact of the mockery and disdain from those who are proud and arrogant.
